data.title: Prime Power
data.statement:
A prime power is a positive integer power of a single prime number. For example: 7 = 7^1, 9 = 3^2 and 64 = 2^6 are prime powers, while 6 = 2 × 3, 12 = 2^2 × 3 and 36 = 6^2 = 2^2 × 3^2 are not.

The goal is to find out whether the input is a prime power (print  the prime and the power separated by "^" in this case) or not (print "Not a prime power in this case")

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testOut: Not a prime power in this case

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testOut: Not a prime power in this case

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n write i^j or Not a prime power
data.inputDescription: [[n]] integer to check if it is a prime power or not
data.outputDescription:
print "prime_number^power in this case" if [[n]] is a prime power

print "Not a prime power in this case" if not

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A prime power is a positive integer power of a single prime number. For example: 7 = 7^1, 9 = 3^2 and 64 = 2^6 are prime powers, while 6 = 2 × 3, 12 = 2^2 × 3 and 36 = 6^2 = 2^2 × 3^2 are not.

The goal is to find out whether the input is a prime power (print the prime and the power separated by "^" in this case) or not (print "Not a prime power in this case")
Input
n integer to check if it is a prime power or not
Output
print "prime_number^power in this case" if n is a prime power

print "Not a prime power in this case" if not
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 1073741824
1 ≤ power ≤ 30
Example
Input
64
Output
2^6 in this case
